section.para: In an international trade transaction, you can use this (FT) module to request a fund transfer, for which the bank (called the Ordering Bank) can subsequently send an acknowledgement upon successful completion.

The module allows the user to remit own account and credit the account of beneficiary.Transfers can be of the following two types:
Internal: Use this transfer type to transfer funds between two accounts both belonging to your company.
Outgoing: Use this transfer type when an external beneficiary is the recipient of the transfer, possibly with another banking institution acting as an intermediary. An outgoing transfer is also called a third-party transfer.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The guide uses the terms "FT" and "Fund Transfer" interchangeably.
The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Fund Transfer Landing Page
section.para: The Fund Transfer Landing page displays a list of FTs that are in various stages of an FT life cycle. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.
The following image illustrates the Fund Transfer landing page:

The following button enables you to initiate a new Fund Transfer request from scratch.
Request Fund Transfer
Enter the desired terms of a new Fund Transfer and submit them to the Issuing Bank of your choice.

The following ribbon items enable you perform various actions on individual FTs or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Draft
Lists all the FTs in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing Fund Transfer transactions that are awaiting client approval.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing Fund Transfer that are awaiting bank approval.
Approved
Lists all the approved Fund Transfer records by the bank.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected Fund Transfer records by the bank. The status given to such FTs is "Not Processed".
Closed
Lists all the FUnd Transfer transactions that have been marked as purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Fund Transfer Type, Beneficiary Name,Channel Reference, Bank Reference, Currency, and Value Date. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant FTs. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed FTs:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of FTs
CSV Download: Download the list of FT transactions displayed on the dashboard. Click on the Download icon to list the formats in which the files can be downloaded. You can download Current Data or Full Data.
Current Data: Downloads the transactions displayed on screen.
Full Data: Downloads all the transactions available under a particular status tab like Draft, Rejected and more.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed FTs.

section.para:
Click on Templates icon on the landing page to open the Template Maintenance form. The Template Maintenance form displays a list of templates that the corporate user has created. The list of templates are segregated over the following tabs:

section.title: Licenses
section.para: Click on the Select License button and the List of licenses appears. Use License Number and Currency fields to narrow down your search.

important.para: There are a few conditions that must be met for the licenses to be displayed in the popup. The following provides information for the conditions that could point to reasons that make licenses available or not available in the popup:

listitem.para: You should have created license(s) and linked it to the beneficiary selected in the Secondary Beneficiary Details section on this page. If you have selected a drawee for whom there are no licenses created, the popup will display a blank list. (This condition applies only if your administrator has selected Non-Principal Only in the License Definition. For any other selection, all licenses are available.)

Your selection of the transfer expiry date for the LC from the general details section should be within the valid to and from date of the license. Only licenses that match this criterion are displayed. If the transfer expiry date is beyond the license validity date, the list displays blank.

Your selection of multi-currency during license creation will allow you to select a currency in the Transfer Amount field that is different from the license currency and display the license in the popup. However, if multi-currency has not been selected, then the currency in the Transfer Amount field has to be the same as the license field for the license to be available in the popup.

section.para: Once you have selected a license, you have to enter a value in the Allocated Amount field that is equal to the transaction amount of the LC (refer to Amount Details section). If the amount available for the license is less than the transaction amount of the FT, you have to add and link one or more licenses to fill for the deficit.

If you have already linked a license, the details are displayed for System ID, Back Office Reference, License Number and Allocated Amount. You can choose to delete a linked license by clicking the Delete icon in the right-hand column.
